channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8192] Logic errror causes infinite loop in HRegion.bulkLoadHFiles(List)
item.description:
the wrong logic is here:
when a ColumnFamily does not exist, it gets a null store object, then ioes.add(ioe); failures.add(p)
but the code below, if (failures.size() != 0), it prints a warn log and return false, so it will never go into the code if (ioes.size() != 0) below, and IOException will not be thrown, then the client will keep retry forever.
there is the same situation when doing store.assertBulkLoadHFileOk, if any WrongRegionException is caught and failures.add(p), then all the other IOException thrown by assertBulkLoadHFileOk will be ignored.

so i think if (failures.size() != 0) {} should be dealt with after if (ioes.size() !=0) {}


for (Pair<byte[], String> p : familyPaths) {

    byte[] familyName = p.getFirst();

    String path = p.getSecond();



    Store store = getStore(familyName);

    if (store == null) {

        IOException ioe = new DoNotRetryIOException(

                "No such column family " + Bytes.toStringBinary(familyName));

        ioes.add(ioe);

        failures.add(p);

    } else {

        try {

            store.assertBulkLoadHFileOk(new Path(path));

        } catch (WrongRegionException wre) {

            // recoverable (file doesn't fit in region)

            failures.add(p);

        } catch (IOException ioe) {

            // unrecoverable (hdfs problem)

            ioes.add(ioe);

        }

    }

}





// validation failed, bail out before doing anything permanent.

if (failures.size() != 0) {

    StringBuilder list = new StringBuilder();

    for (Pair<byte[], String> p : failures) {

        list.append("\n").append(Bytes.toString(p.getFirst())).append(" : ")

            .append(p.getSecond());

    }

    // problem when validating

    LOG.warn("There was a recoverable bulk load failure likely due to a" +

            " split.  These (family, HFile) pairs were not loaded: " + list);

    return false;

}



// validation failed because of some sort of IO problem.

if (ioes.size() != 0) {

    LOG.error("There were IO errors when checking if bulk load is ok.  " +

            "throwing exception!");

    throw MultipleIOException.createIOException(ioes);

}
item.summary: Logic errror causes infinite loop in HRegion.bulkLoadHFiles(List)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Oh, curious. Can you put together a test script or sequence of bash commands that expresses this scenario? Maybe based off of the simple dataset used in the ImportTsv instructions?

Thanks for reporting, Chenghao.
From javadoc of bulkLoadHFiles():


   * @return true if successful, false if failed recoverably

When "No such column family", I don't think it qualifies as recoverable error.

When store == null, it's not necessary to add it to failures, since "No such column family" is not recoverable.
On the other hand, if there is an IOException in ioes, it should be dealt with first (before dealing with failures), since any IOException in ioes means unrecoverable.

@Chenghao:
Any chance of a patch ?

Thanks
Please see http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/Hbase/HowToContribute for how to generate patch.
Thanks.

Please generate the patch from root of your workspace.
i.e. the path to HRegion.java should be:

hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/regionserver/HRegion.java

You're so nice
Thanks again.
Next you can click 'Submit Patch' button.
Fix Version should be 0.94.7 because all the others have been released already.
OK.

+1. The patch looks good to me.

Jonathan Hsieh:
Can you take a look at the patch ?
Can we add a test for this case to?

This is first patch from Chenghao.

Can we add test case in a follow-on JIRA ?

Its good to pick up good habits on the first patch. Since this is a logic bug, I feel a little more strongly about unit testing.

Chenghao Jiang let us know if you plan on adding it and want help or if I should add the test.

I'm trying to setting up the development environment, there's still some problems whem compiling.
I'm reading some test code to study the way of testing. Since I still don't know enough about hbase code, it'll take a little bit more time to do the test.

Chenghao Jiang] I assumed that since you submitted a patch that you had that setup already, but it sounds like you want to take a stab at it.

Here's a link to setting up a dev env. http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#developer

Here's a place where there are related tests – copy and hack one of them to prove the case that had the logic bug.
https://github.com/apache/hbase/blob/trunk/hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/mapreduce/TestLoadIncrementalHFiles.java

There are some problems while running test "TestLoadIncrementalHFiles" in my environment.

Just have a try with a new patch that has one more test.

v3 upload a wrong file.

The new test still fails:


Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles.copyHFileHalf(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:607)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles.splitStoreFile(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:592)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles.splitStoreFile(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:416)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles.groupOrSplit(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:480)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles$2.call(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:364)

  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.LoadIncrementalHFiles$2.call(LoadIncrementalHFiles.java:362)

  at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)

This is due to familyDescriptor being null in copyHFileHalf():


    HFileDataBlockEncoder dataBlockEncoder = new HFileDataBlockEncoderImpl(

        familyDescriptor.getDataBlockEncodingOnDisk(),

        familyDescriptor.getDataBlockEncoding());

Please handle the above case.

Thanks

This message is automatically generated.

It seems that there is another problem in LoadIncrementalHFiles.java
In LoadIncrementalHFiles.doBulkLoad(Path hfofDir, final HTable table), it discoverLoadQueue(queue, hfofDir) to get a queue containing all the HFiles.
Then we can check if all the families in the queue exist in the HTable. If not, exception should be thrown since this bulkLoad will never succeed, just like throwing TableNotFoundException when table does not exist.
If we don't check this, split the hfile whose data belongs to a nonexistent family will fail since information about the family will be used when copyHFileHalf().

In v6, hfileRanges has been set that there is no split.

Problem when it needs split has been described above.

TestTableLockManager failure is tracked in HBASE-8164


      assertTrue(false);

Please add a message saying why we fail the test.


+    } catch (Exception e) {

+	  e.printStackTrace();

Stack printing is not needed above.


+      assertTrue(e instanceof IOException);

Add message for the case where assertion fails.


+    HTable table = new HTable(util.getConfiguration(), TABLE);

Looks like the table is not closed.
Patch v7 addresses the above comments.
